summary: The document is a memorandum from the Director of Central Intelligence, dated 29 July 1975, addressed to members of the USIB Ad Hoc Coordinating Group. It concerns the certification of security clearances for staff personnel of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, affirming their eligibility for access to classified information up to and including TOP SECRET under Executive Order 10450. An attached list provides detailed information on individuals, including their compartmented clearance statuses, briefing dates, places of birth, and social security numbers.
key_findings: The document was released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It outlines the security clearance procedures for individuals linked to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities.
Individuals listed are certified for access to classified information up to TOP SECRET, with some holding additional compartmented clearances.
Personal details of the individuals, such as names, dates of birth, places of birth, and social security numbers, are included.
keywords: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
